description: From Middle English sonnelight, sunneliht, from Old English sunnan lēoht (“sunlight”), equivalent to sun +‎ light. Cognate with Dutch zonlicht (“sunlight”), German Low German Sünnenlücht (“sunlight”), German Sonnenlicht (“sunlight”).

entries.meaning: All the electromagnetic radiation given off by the Sun, especially that in the visible spectrum that bathes the Earth.
examples: Sunlight on the skin gives you vitamin D.

verbs.description: sunlight (third-person singular simple present sunlights, present participle sunlighting, simple past and past participle sunlighted)

entries.meaning: To work on the side (at a secondary job) during the daytime.
